dashboard.description: Uploaded by https://gitlab.com/gitlab-com/runbooks/-/jobs/1262189723 at Fri May 14 09:02:12 UTC 2021

panels.description: Apdex is a measure of requests that complete within a tolerable period of time for the service. Higher is better.

seriesOverrides.alias: 6h Degradation SLO (5% of monthly error budget)
1h Outage SLO (2% of monthly error budget)

targets.legendFormat: 6h Degradation SLO (5% of monthly error budget)
1h Outage SLO (2% of monthly error budget)

panels.title: kube Service Apdex

targets.expr:
sum(
  label_replace(
    vector(0) and on() (gitlab_service_apdex:ratio_1h{env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",type="kube"}),
    "period", "na", "", ""
  )
  or
  label_replace(
    vector(1) and on () (gitlab_service_apdex:ratio_5m{env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",type="kube"} < on(tier, type) group_left() (1 - (14.4 * (1 - slo:min:events:gitlab_service_apdex:ratio{monitor="global",type="kube"})))),
    "period", "5m", "", ""
  )
  or
  label_replace(
    vector(2) and on () (gitlab_service_apdex:ratio_1h{env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",type="kube"} < on(tier, type) group_left() (1 - (14.4 * (1 - slo:min:events:gitlab_service_apdex:ratio{monitor="global",type="kube"})))),
    "period", "1h", "", ""
  )
  or
  label_replace(
    vector(4) and on () (gitlab_service_apdex:ratio_30m{env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",type="kube"} < on(tier, type) group_left() (1 - (6 * (1 - slo:min:events:gitlab_service_apdex:ratio{monitor="global",type="kube"})))),
    "period", "30m", "", ""
  )
  or
  label_replace(
    vector(8) and on () (gitlab_service_apdex:ratio_6h{env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",type="kube"} < on(tier, type) group_left() (1 - (6 * (1 - slo:min:events:gitlab_service_apdex:ratio{monitor="global",type="kube"})))),
    "period", "6h", "", ""
  )
)

panels.description: Error rates are a measure of unhandled service exceptions per second. Client errors are excluded when possible. Lower is better

seriesOverrides.alias: 6h Degradation SLO (5% of monthly error budget)
1h Outage SLO (2% of monthly error budget)

targets.legendFormat: 6h Degradation SLO (5% of monthly error budget)
1h Outage SLO (2% of monthly error budget)

panels.title: kube Service Error Ratio

targets.expr:
sum (
  label_replace(
    vector(0) and on() (gitlab_service_errors:ratio_1h{env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",type="kube"}),
    "period", "na", "", ""
  )
  or
  label_replace(
    vector(1) and on() (gitlab_service_errors:ratio_5m{env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",type="kube"} > on(tier, type) group_left() (14.4 * slo:max:events:gitlab_service_errors:ratio{monitor="global",type="kube"})),
    "period", "5m", "", ""
  )
  or
  label_replace(
    vector(2) and on() (gitlab_service_errors:ratio_1h{env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",type="kube"} > on(tier, type) group_left() (14.4 * slo:max:events:gitlab_service_errors:ratio{monitor="global",type="kube"})),
    "period", "1h", "", ""
  )
  or
  label_replace(
    vector(4) and on() (gitlab_service_errors:ratio_30m{env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",type="kube"} > on(tier, type) group_left() (6 * slo:max:events:gitlab_service_errors:ratio{monitor="global",type="kube"})),
    "period", "30m", "", ""
  )
  or
  label_replace(
    vector(8) and on() (gitlab_service_errors:ratio_6h{env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",type="kube"} > on(tier, type) group_left() (6 * slo:max:events:gitlab_service_errors:ratio{monitor="global",type="kube"})),
    "period", "6h", "", ""
  )
)

panels.description: The operation rate is the sum total of all requests being handle for all components within this service. Note that a single user request can lead to requests to multiple components. Higher is busier.
panels.title: kube Service RPS - Requests per Second

panels.description: Saturation is a measure of what ratio of a finite resource is currently being utilized. Lower is better.

panels.title: apiserver SLI Apdex

targets.expr:
sum(
  label_replace(
    vector(0) and on() (gitlab_component_apdex:ratio_1h{component="apiserver",env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",type="kube"}),
    "period", "na", "", ""
  )
  or
  label_replace(
    vector(1) and on () (gitlab_component_apdex:ratio_5m{component="apiserver",env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",type="kube"} < on(tier, type) group_left() (1 - (14.4 * (1 - slo:min:events:gitlab_service_apdex:ratio{monitor="global",type="kube"})))),
    "period", "5m", "", ""
  )
  or
  label_replace(
    vector(2) and on () (gitlab_component_apdex:ratio_1h{component="apiserver",env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",type="kube"} < on(tier, type) group_left() (1 - (14.4 * (1 - slo:min:events:gitlab_service_apdex:ratio{monitor="global",type="kube"})))),
    "period", "1h", "", ""
  )
  or
  label_replace(
    vector(4) and on () (gitlab_component_apdex:ratio_30m{component="apiserver",env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",type="kube"} < on(tier, type) group_left() (1 - (6 * (1 - slo:min:events:gitlab_service_apdex:ratio{monitor="global",type="kube"})))),
    "period", "30m", "", ""
  )
  or
  label_replace(
    vector(8) and on () (gitlab_component_apdex:ratio_6h{component="apiserver",env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",type="kube"} < on(tier, type) group_left() (1 - (6 * (1 - slo:min:events:gitlab_service_apdex:ratio{monitor="global",type="kube"})))),
    "period", "6h", "", ""
  )
)

panels.title: apiserver SLI RPS - Requests per Second

panels.content:
### Description

The Kubernetes API server validates and configures data for the api objects which
include pods, services, and others. The API Server services REST operations
and provides the frontend to the cluster's shared state through which all other components
interact.

This SLI measures all non-health-check endpoints. Long-polling endpoints are excluded from apdex scores.



### Observability Tools

* [Kubernetes Cluster Logs](https://console.cloud.google.com/logs/query;query=resource%2Etype%3D%22k8s%5Fcluster%22;timeRange=PT30M?project=gitlab-production)
* [Kubernetes Cluster Warning Logs](https://console.cloud.google.com/logs/query;query=resource%2Etype%3D%22k8s%5Fcluster%22%0Aseverity%3D%28%22EMERGENCY%22%20OR%20%22ALERT%22%20OR%20%22CRITICAL%22%20OR%20%22ERROR%22%20OR%20%22WARNING%22%29;timeRange=PT30M?project=gitlab-production)

panels.description:
disk space utilization on persistent volume claims.
 Lower is better.

targets.expr:
clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    max by(environment, persistentvolumeclaim) (
  clamp_min(
    clamp_max(
      kubelet_volume_stats_used_bytes
      /
      kubelet_volume_stats_capacity_bytes
      ,
      1)
  ,
  0)
)

  ,1)
,0)

panels.title: kube_persistent_volume_claim_disk_space component saturation: Kube Persistent Volume Claim inode Utilisation

panels.description:
inode utilization on persistent volume claims.
 Lower is better.

targets.expr:
clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    max by(environment, persistentvolumeclaim) (
  clamp_min(
    clamp_max(
      kubelet_volume_stats_inodes_used
      /
      kubelet_volume_stats_inodes
      ,
      1)
  ,
  0)
)

  ,1)
,0)

panels.title: kube_persistent_volume_claim_inodes component saturation: Kube Persistent Volume Claim inode Utilisation

panels.description:
A GKE kubernetes node pool is close to it's maximum number of nodes.

The maximum is defined in terraform, via the `max_node_count` field of a node pool. The limit is per-zone, so for
single zone clusters the number of nodes will match the limit, for regional clusters, the limit is multiplied by
the number of zones the cluster is deployed over.
 Lower is better.

targets.expr:
clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    max by(environment, tier, type, stage, cluster, label_pool, shard) (
  clamp_min(
    clamp_max(
      count by (cluster, env, environment, label_pool, tier, type, stage, shard) (
        kube_node_labels:labeled{env="$environment",environment="$environment",type="kube"}
      )
      / on(cluster, env, environment, label_pool) group_left() (
        label_replace(
          terraform_report_google_cluster_node_pool_max_node_count,
          "label_pool", "$0", "pool_name", ".*"
        )
        * on(cluster, env, environment) group_left()
        count by (cluster, env, environment) (
          group by (cluster, env, environment, label_topology_kubernetes_io_zone) (
            kube_node_labels:labeled{env="$environment",environment="$environment",type="kube"}
          )
        )
      )
      ,
      1)
  ,
  0)
)

  ,1)
,0)

panels.title: kube_pool_max_nodes component saturation: Kube Pool Max Node Limit

panels.description: Lists saturated resources that are breaching their soft SLO thresholds at this instant

styles.linkTooltip: Click the link to review the past 1 day(s) history for this saturation point.
Click the link to find issues on GitLab.com related to this saturation point.

targets.expr:
(
  max by (type, stage, component) (
  clamp_max(
    gitlab_component_saturation:ratio{environment="$environment", env="$environment",environment="$environment",type="kube"}
    ,
    1
  ) >= on(component, monitor, env, cluster) group_left slo:max:soft:gitlab_component_saturation:ratio
)

)
* on(component) group_left(alert_dashboard, severity)
(
  absent(fake_dne{component="cgroup_memory", alert_dashboard="sat_cgroup_memory", severity="s4"})
or
absent(fake_dne{component="cpu", alert_dashboard="sat_cpu", severity="s3"})
or
absent(fake_dne{component="disk_inodes", alert_dashboard="sat_disk_inodes", severity="s2"})
or
absent(fake_dne{component="disk_space", alert_dashboard="sat_disk_space", severity="s2"})

panels.title: Currently Saturated Resources

panels.description: Lists saturated resources that, given their current value and weekly variance, have a high probability of breaching their soft thresholds limits within the next few hours

styles.linkTooltip: Click the link to review the past 7 day(s) history for this saturation point.
Click the link to find issues on GitLab.com related to this saturation point.

targets.expr:
(
  sort_desc(
  max by (type, stage, component) (
    clamp_max(
      gitlab_component_saturation:ratio:avg_over_time_1w{
        environment="$environment",
        env="$environment",environment="$environment",type="kube"
      } +
      2 *
        gitlab_component_saturation:ratio:stddev_over_time_1w{
          environment="$environment",
          env="$environment",environment="$environment",type="kube"
        }
      , 1
    )
    >= on(component, monitor, env, cluster) group_left slo:max:soft:gitlab_component_saturation:ratio
  )
)

)
* on(component) group_left(alert_dashboard, severity)
(
  absent(fake_dne{component="cgroup_memory", alert_dashboard="sat_cgroup_memory", severity="s4"})
or
absent(fake_dne{component="cpu", alert_dashboard="sat_cpu", severity="s3"})
or
absent(fake_dne{component="disk_inodes", alert_dashboard="sat_disk_inodes", severity="s2"})

or

panels.title: Resources Currently at Risk of being Saturated

panels.description: Lists saturated resources that, given their growth rate over the the past week, and their weekly variance, are likely to breach their soft thresholds limits in the next 14d

styles.linkTooltip: Click the link to review the past 30 day(s) history for this saturation point.
Click the link to find issues on GitLab.com related to this saturation point.

targets.expr:
(
  sort_desc(
  max by (type, stage, component) (
    clamp_max(
      gitlab_component_saturation:ratio:predict_linear_2w{
        environment="$environment",
        env="$environment",environment="$environment",type="kube"
      } +
      2 *
        gitlab_component_saturation:ratio:stddev_over_time_1w{
          environment="$environment",
          env="$environment",environment="$environment",type="kube"
        }
    , 1
    )
    >= on(component, monitor, env, cluster) group_left slo:max:soft:gitlab_component_saturation:ratio
  )
)

)
* on(component) group_left(alert_dashboard, severity)
(
  absent(fake_dne{component="cgroup_memory", alert_dashboard="sat_cgroup_memory", severity="s4"})
or
absent(fake_dne{component="cpu", alert_dashboard="sat_cpu", severity="s3"})
or
absent(fake_dne{component="disk_inodes", alert_dashboard="sat_disk_inodes", severity="s2"})
or
absent(fake_dne{component="disk_space", alert_dashboard="sat_disk_space", severity="s2"})
or
absent(fake_dne{component="disk_sustained_read_iops", alert_dashboard="sat_disk_sus_read_iops", severity="s3"})
or
absent(fake_dne{component="disk_sustained_read_throughput", alert_dashboard="sat_disk_sus_read_throughput", severity="s3"})
or
absent(fake_dne{component="disk_sustained_write_iops", alert_dashboard="sat_disk_sus_write_iops", severity="s3"})
or
absent(fake_dne{component="disk_sustained_write_throughput", alert_dashboard="sat_disk_sus_write_throughput", severity="s3"})
or
absent(fake_dne{component="elastic_cpu", alert_dashboard="sat_elastic_cpu", severity="s4"})
